summary: In Requiem, the divines offer overpowered protection to their adherents. But not if you steal. This mod allows more stealing while retaining the "unforgivable" sins.
descriptionHtml:
[b][color=#1e84cc][size=4]What does this mod do?
[/size][/color][/b]
In the roleplaying overhaul mod [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/19281/?]Requiem[/url] the shrines offer buffs and protections based on which Divine you worship.

However, there are a few ways to lose your blessing:

[list]
[*]If you murder 1 person (permanent, unless painful regrets perk used)
[*]If you steal 10 things 
[*]If you accrue a bounty (temporary)
[*]If you accrue a lifetime bounty (permanent)
[/list]
This makes playing a thief or joining the Thieves Guild a no-go, which locks out a lot of content for players who want to use the divines but also enjoy the fun aspect of thievery. Even joining the thieves guild, despite having a bounty of zero and a lifetime theft count of zero, results in immediate banishment from the Divines.

We could debate all day about whether the Divines care about theft, but at the end of the day this mod allows you to roleplay that they don't. Perhaps you're playing a Robin Hood. Perhaps you're infiltrating the Thieves Guild to change it from the inside. Perhaps you're a thief because you have nowhere else to turn. So long as you don't commit an unforgivable sin, the Divines will look kindly on your penance.

[color=#1e84cc][size=4]What changes did you make?[/size][/color]

Generally speaking, the following rules apply to all Divine Blessings (Nocturnal excluded):

[list]
[*]You can now accrue a bounty of 10,500 septims before losing your blessing
[*]You can now steal unlimited objects, unless you get caught and accrue a bounty above 10,500 septims
[*]You can now join the Thieves Guild without being punished by the Divines
[/list]
[color=#1e84cc][size=4]What did you leave alone?[/size][/color]

A murder of any kind results in a permanent loss of your blessing (unless you follow the Painful Regrets perk). Dark Brotherhood membership and murder conditions have been left unchanged (killing Grelod the Kind doesn't count as a murder).

[color=#1e84cc][size=4]Is this compatible with Behind the Curtain?[/size][/color]

No. I began looking through it and I could edit the conditions to allow theft but ZeroMorph's mod is really a purist roleplaying overhaul that examines devotees of the Divines. I think if you want to enjoy the huge buffs that come with that mod you should force yourself to play by its rules.

Or you could [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/85532/?]use this[/url].

[color=#1e84cc][size=4]I want my blessings no matter what crimes I commit, even murder[/size][/color]

No problem, download [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/50251/?]this file[/url].
